title: Ash - Day 2 Part 1
description: Understanding risk management, position sizing, and the importance of stop losses and risk-reward ratios.
content:
In this lesson, you'll learn:

• How to measure risk per trade
• Understanding risk-reward ratios (1:2, 1:3)
• The dangers of overleveraging
• How stop losses protect your capital
• Position sizing based on account size
• Building consistent profit through proper risk management

quiz.question: What is risk per trade usually measured in?
quiz.explanation: Risk is measured in pips (for Forex/stocks) or percentage of account, consistently applied to all trades.

quiz.question: A 1:2 RR means:
quiz.explanation: A 1:2 risk-reward means for every 1 unit risked, you target 2 units of profit.

quiz.question: Overleveraging causes:
quiz.explanation: High leverage amplifies losses, making account blowups more likely even with small losses.

quiz.question: Stop loss protects:
quiz.explanation: Stop losses limit losses and protect your trading capital from catastrophic losses.

quiz.question: Position sizing depends on:
quiz.explanation: Position size must be calculated based on account size and risk per trade, not emotions or random factors.
